text:
Problem: the Apache httd, running normally otherwise, giving an error message 
and exiting, when a dll file exists in the /modules directory.  The error 
message is saying that a file is not in the form of SO and perhaps corrupted.

I am integrating Oracle9i Personal Edition isqlplus web-based tool with 
Apache_1.3.2.4-win32 httd, installed separately at home.  Oracle9i installation 
provides for a plug-in (mod_ioplus.dll) for Apache web server.  This plug in 
must be started by the Apache httpd.
creator: mkozyurt@hotmail.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please contact oracle... we don't support 3rd party modules.
  It was probably compiled for the different version of Apache
  than you are running.
